zh-CN.title: PsXTRA v2.1 (Beta 4)
zh-CN.prs1: [Colchetes + pontos de exclamação após o resultado (estilo Microsoft) !!!]
zh-CN.prs2: [Colchetes + números cardinais em inglês após o resultado (estilo Android) (por exemplo: one two three)].
zh-CN.prs3: [Colchetes + adicionar dígitos após o resultado (por exemplo: 12345)].
zh-CN.cuset: Texto a ser adicionado repetidamente após o resultado:
zh-CN.hashtxt: [Abc12]Adicione um pseudo Hash ID (identificador de recurso) (uma sequência de letras + números com um determinado número de dígitos)
zh-CN.nctxt: Substitua os dígitos 1-9 pelos dígitos circulados ①-⑨

en.resph: Your translation will be shown here
en.title: PsXTRA v2.1 (Beta 4)
en.prs0: Do not add prefix or suffix
en.prs1: [Brackets + exclamation marks after the result (Microsoft style) !!!]
en.prs2: [Brackets + English cardinal numbers after the result (Android Style) (e.g.: one two three)]
en.cuset: Text to add repeatedly after the result:
en.hashtxt: [Abc12]Add a pseudo Hash ID (Resource Identifier) (a string of letters + numbers with a certain number of digits)
en.nctxt: Replace digits 1-9 with circled digits ①-⑨
en.whattxt:
Pseudolocalization (or qps-ploc, qps-plocm, qps-ploca, en-XA, en-XB) is a way to simulate the localization process. By doing so, the localization team will be able to effectively investigate issues that might occur during localization process (incorrect display of characters due to string length, etc.)
During pseudo-localization, English letters are replaced with accents and characters from other scripts. (For example, the letter a is replaced by any one of αäáàāāǎǎăăåå selected at random. ), separators etc. are also added to increase the string length.
For Example：“Windows Photo Gallery” → “ [1iaT9][ Ẅĭпðøωś Þнôтŏ Ģάŀļєяÿ !!! !] ”
More information: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/globalization/methodology/pseudolocalization

More features are on the way. Thanks for your support!
en.logtxt:
v1.0


* Initial release.

v1.0.1


* Minor tweaks and improvements

v1.1


* Backported some features and fixes from the legacy PsExtra to Lite, along with more new features

v1.2


* New features

v1.2.1


* Temporarily disable the en-XB option (sorry!)

v1.3.0-beta.1


* Mobile fixes
* Replaced the link that leads to Suntrise's website with a rickroll as a placeholder

v1.3.0-beta.2


* The homepage link (in Chinese version) is no longer a placeholder

v2.0.0


* Too lazy to add a changelog :(

v2.0.1


* Updated the author's name (for MSVEC1024 rebrand)
* Some tweaks

v2.0.5


too lazy to add changelog

v2.0.6


* Updated the author's name again (for MSVE640 rebrand)

v2.1.0-alpha.1


* The background is no longer a checkerboard. It is now a photo depicting a leaf (image credit in repo README) (WIP, subject to change in future versions)

v2.1.0-alpha.2


* Fixed the leaf wallpaper being visible only in half
* Replaced the Roboto font with Droid Sans (applies to both desktop and mobile)
* Most of the text is white now
* Improved the code a bit

v2.1.0-beta.1


* Fixed some parts of the text still being in Roboto (css originally owned by Google)

v2.1.0-beta.2


* Mobile quirk fixes (ugh)
* Fixed bold text still being black (DARN IT)

v2.1.0-beta.3


* Removed a leftover from pre-PsXTRA in mobile version

v2.1.0-beta.3a


* Fixed text that belong to the h4 HTML tag still being black (DAMN IT!)

v2.1.0-beta.4 (WIP)


* Brought back the stats thingy from pre-PsXTRA, now showing the amount of hits the repo of this site has
* Fixed the leaf image being screwed up on some screen resolutions
* Better strings
* Brought back a feature from PSLOR (defunct psxtra prequel) (Currently WIP)
